_description: Performance benchmark targets for CI comparison. Tests fail if actual performance is below tolerance threshold.
_usage: Used by pytest-benchmark and CI workflows to validate performance regressions.
_tolerance_note: tolerance is a multiplier - 0.8 means 80% of target is passing threshold for throughput, 1.2 means 120% is passing for latency

bar_generation.description: All bar generators must achieve at least 1M rows/sec throughput

renko_bars.description: Renko bar generation throughput with 1M rows

range_bars.description: Range bar generation throughput with 1M rows

tick_bars.description: Tick bar generation throughput with 1M rows

volume_bars.description: Volume bar generation throughput with 1M rows

dollar_bars.description: Dollar bar generation throughput with 1M rows

tick_imbalance_bars.description: Tick Imbalance bar generation throughput with 1M rows

volume_imbalance_bars.description: Volume Imbalance bar generation throughput with 1M rows

single_backtest.description: Single backtest execution latency. Aspirational: 50ms, Practical: 200ms (VectorBT overhead)

data_loading_1M.description: Loading 1M rows from CSV/Parquet must complete in under 2 seconds

peak_memory_5M.description: Peak memory usage for 5M rows must stay under 2GB

_ci_thresholds.description: CI will fail if any benchmark regresses by more than 20% from baseline
